channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Meet the millionaires living the ‘underconsumption’ life: They drive secondhand cars, batch cook, and never buy new clothes
item.description: From thrifted clothes to no gifts at the holidays, these millionaires are living an 'underconsumption' life which has opened up financial freedom.

item.title: With Trump in Power, Democrats Try to Redefine Themselves as Disrupters
item.description: Since President Trump’s rise, Democrats have served as defenders of a political system many Americans believe is broken. Now the party is trying a new...

item.title: California Gets Heavy Rain, Snarled Travel and Power Outages for Christmas
item.description: Officials warned that driving for holiday celebrations would be hazardous across much of the state, with heavy rain still to fall in some places.

item.title: Logan Paul auctions off $5.3 million Pokémon card, urging young people to invest more in nontraditional assets: ‘Don’t be afraid to take a risk’
item.description: Pokémon cards have seen the largest long-term increase in value among all card categories.

item.title: Amazon’s Alexa chief predicts an end to doom scrolling: the next generation is ‘going to just think differently’

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg gifted noise-canceling headphones to his Palo Alto neighbors because of the nonstop construction around his 11 homes
item.description: This isn’t the first time Zuckerberg has clashed with neighbors over real estate projects.

item.title: $1.817 Billion Powerball Jackpot Won by Single Ticket in Arkansas
item.description: A single ticket drawn Wednesday night won the second-largest U.S. lottery jackpot ever.

item.title: Gen Z founder on ‘AI anxiety’ and being pigeonholed as generation shortcut: that’s the ‘biggest misconception’
item.description: "We don't really know what to do but we know it's coming and nobody is moving as fast to solve the problem," said Kiara Nirghin. AI or climate anxiety...

item.title: Christmas Around the World in Photos
item.description: The holiday spirit is bringing people together, with celebrations of lights, dance and Santa.

item.title: Honduran Candidate Claims Fraud After Trump-Backed Opponent Is Declared Victor
item.description: After officials called the presidential race for Nasry Asfura, his rival, Salvador Nasralla, disputed the result and expressed ire over the U.S. role.

item.title: Five Killed in Helicopter Crash on Kilimanjaro, Africa’s Highest Peak
item.description: The aircraft was on its descent from the mountain when it crashed around the Barafu Camp area in Kilimanjaro National Park, officials said.
